item.title: 飓风对医疗产品部门的影响挥之不去，百特下调预期，业绩不及预期
item.description: 百特国际公司周四下调了 2025 年的利润预期，由于飓风海伦（Helene）的持续影响，该公司的一个关键生产设施受损，对静脉注射液的需求减少，季度盈利未能达到分析师的预期。【原文：Baxter International cut its 2025 profit forecast on Thursday, while quarterly earnings missed analysts' estimates due to the lingering effect of Hurricane Helene, which damaged a key manufacturing facility and reduced demand for IV solutions.】

item.title: 英国出口金融公司为福特英国公司的 10 亿英镑贷款提供担保
item.description: 英国政府机构正在向美国汽车制造商福特公司的英国分公司提供 10 亿英镑的出口发展担保，以支持该公司在全球的长期发展目标。【原文：A British government agency is providing a 1 billion pound export development guarantee to the UK arm of U.S. carmaker Ford , supporting the company's long-term growth targets around the world.】

item.title: 美国第二季度劳动力成本增幅略超预期
item.description: 美国第二季度劳动力成本增幅略高于预期，原因是工资增长回升，而劳动力市场状况正在趋于缓和。【原文：U.S. labor costs increased slightly more than expected in the second quarter amid a pick-up in wage growth even as labor market conditions are easing.】

item.title: 美国财政部长称有望年底前宣布美联储主席人选
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周四表示，他正在整理一份领导美国联邦储备委员会的潜在候选人名单，预计将在今年年底前公布。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Thursday he is pulling together a list of potential candidates to lead the U.S. Federal Reserve and that he expects an announcement by the end of the year.】

item.title: 亨廷顿-英格尔斯公司季度业绩高居榜首，造船业困境有所缓解
item.description: 美国军用造船厂亨廷顿-英格尔斯（Huntington Ingalls）周四公布的第二季度业绩高于华尔街预期，原因是其造船厂的生产问题有所缓解，而且对潜艇的需求大增。【原文：U.S. military shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls reported second-quarter results above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as production issues ease at its shipyards and demand booms for submarines.】

item.title: 美国消费支出紧缩，凯拉诺瓦季度利润不及预期
item.description: 由于宏观经济的不确定性给消费者支出带来压力，包括 Pringles 和 Pop-Tarts 在内的即食早餐和零食需求疲软，凯兰诺瓦公司周四公布的第二季度利润不及华尔街预期。【原文：Kellanova missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday on softening demand for its ready-to-eat breakfast items and snacks including Pringles and Pop-Tarts, as macroeconomic uncertainty pressures consumer spending.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数小幅上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数量略有增加，表明劳动力市场保持稳定，尽管下岗工人需要更长的时间才能找到新的工作机会。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased marginally last week, suggesting that the labor market remained stable, though it is taking longer for laid-off workers to find new opportunities.】

item.title: 美国 6 月通胀回升；消费支出温和增长
item.description: 进口关税开始提高一些商品的成本。【原文：Tariffs on imports started raising the cost of some goods.】

item.title: 恶劣天气影响建筑业，Vulcan 季度业绩未达预期
item.description: Vulcan Materials 公司周四公布的第二季度营收和利润均低于华尔街预期，原因是天气干扰导致建筑活动放缓，并拖累了对其建筑材料的需求。【原文：Vulcan Materials posted second-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as weather disruptions slowed construction activity and weighed on demand for its construction materials.】

item.title: 由于需求强劲，标准普尔全球公司预计年度利润高于预期
item.description: 金融信息公司 S&P Global 周四上调了全年盈利预期，第二季度盈利超出华尔街预期，原因是市场对其数据和分析产品的需求强劲。【原文：Financial information company S&P Global raised its annual profit forecast on Thursday and beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter earnings on strong demand for its data and analytics products.】

item.title: 特朗普的废铜配额太小，无法改变市场格局
item.description: 分析师说，美国废铜出口限制提案旨在减少对海外金属生产的依赖，但不太可能产生太大影响，因为出口量已经低于计划上限。【原文：Proposed limits on U.S. scrap copper exports which aim to reduce reliance on overseas production of the metal, are unlikely to have much impact, analysts say, with exports already below the planned cap.】

item.title: 加拿大 5 月国内生产总值出现萎缩，第二季度可能避免萎缩
item.description: 周四的数据显示，加拿大5月份的国内生产总值符合预期，按月萎缩了0.1%，但在一些行业反弹的带动下，6月份可能会收复失地。【原文：Canada's Gross Domestic Product met expectations and shrank 0.1% in May on a monthly basis, but it is likely to regain the lost output in June led by a rebound in some sectors, data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: SiriusXM 第二季度播客用户减少
item.description: SiriusXM 周四报告称，受独家内容（尤其是播客）需求旺盛以及与著名电视节目主持人特雷弗-诺亚（Trevor Noah）达成协议的影响，直接付费用户的季度降幅小于预期。【原文：SiriusXM on Thursday reported a smaller-than-expected quarterly decline in subscribers who pay directly, aided by strong demand for its exclusive content, especially podcasts, and a deal with popular television host Trevor Noah.】

item.title: 欧盟称，向大型科技公司征收网络费不是促进欧盟数字技术推广的可行方案
item.description: 欧盟执行委员会发言人周四表示，欧盟委员会并不认为向大型科技公司征收网络费是解决 "谁应为 5G 和宽带的推广提供资金 "这一争论的可行方案。【原文：The European Commission does not think that imposing a network fee on Big Tech companies is a viable solution to the debate over who should fund the rollout of 5G and broadband, a spokesman for the EU executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: Sempra 与日本 JERA 签订为期 20 年的液化天然气供应协议
item.description: 美国能源公司森普拉（Sempra）旗下的森普拉基础设施公司（Sempra Infrastructure）周四表示，将在一项为期 20 年的协议中，每年向日本最大的发电企业 JERA 供应 150 万吨液化天然气（LNG）。【原文：Sempra Infrastructure, a unit of U.S. energy company Sempra , will supply 1.5 million tonnes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) per year to Japan's biggest power generator JERA in a 20-year deal, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑集合企业需求购买更多美国天然气
item.description: 欧盟委员会（European Commission）周四表示，该委员会可能会集中欧洲公司的需求，购买更多的美国液化天然气，作为其实现每年购买2,500亿美元美国能源承诺的努力的一部分。【原文：The European Commission could pool demand from European companies to buy more U.S. liquefied natural gas, as part of its efforts to reach a pledge to buy $250 billion in U.S. energy per year, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 印度服装和珠宝业担心关税冲击后的美国订单
item.description: 印度服装和珠宝出口商正在为来自其最大市场的订单减少做准备，并可能在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布从周五开始对印度进口商品征收 25% 的关税后裁员。【原文：India's apparel and jewellery exporters are bracing for a drop in orders from their biggest market and could cut jobs after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a 25% tariff on Indian imports starting on Friday, industry executives said.】

item.title: 消费支出强劲，万事达卡季度利润上升
item.description: 周四，万事达卡公布第二季度利润增长，原因是消费者支出的恢复性增长推动了交易量的增长。【原文：Mastercard reported a higher second-quarter profit on Thursday, as resilient consumer spending boosted transaction volumes.】

item.title: 病毒式点击刺激消费热潮，Roblox 上调年度预订预期
item.description: 周四，Roblox 上调了对年度预订的预期，其电子游戏平台的日活跃用户数量也突破了 1 亿，这得益于 "种植花园 "等病毒性热门游戏的成功，使其股价在收盘前上涨了 12.4%。【原文：Roblox raised its forecast for annual bookings on Thursday and crossed 100 million in daily active users on its videogame platform, riding on the success of viral hits such as "Grow a Garden" and sending its shares up 12.4% before the bell.】

item.title: MPLX 将以 23.8 亿美元收购北风中游公司，扩大二叠纪酸性天然气业务范围
item.description: MPLX LP 周四表示，将以 23.8 亿美元现金收购北风中游公司（Northwind Midstream），以扩大其在二叠纪盆地的酸性气体收集和处理业务，因为生产商正在新墨西哥州加大钻探力度。【原文：MPLX LP said on Thursday it will acquire Northwind Midstream for $2.38 billion in cash to expand its sour gas gathering and processing footprint in the Permian Basin, as producers ramp up drilling in New Mexico.】

item.title: 艾伯维上调年度盈利预期，因新型免疫学药物需求强劲
item.description: 艾伯维周四上调了 2025 年的利润预期，此前由于较新的免疫学药物 Skyrizi 和 Rinvoq 销售强劲，其第二季度业绩超过了华尔街的预期。【原文：AbbVie raised its 2025 profit forecast on Thursday, after beating Wall Street estimates for second-quarter results on strong sales of its newer immunology drugs Skyrizi and Rinvoq.】

item.title: 受运营和维护成本上升影响，PG&E利润不及预期
item.description: 周四，PG&E 公司第二季度利润略低于华尔街预期，该公用事业公司受到运营和维护成本增加的打击，股价在盘前交易中下跌 1.4%。【原文：PG&E Corp on Thursday narrowly missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit, as the utility firm was hit by an increase in operating and maintenance costs, sending its shares down 1.4% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 纽约证交所母公司 ICE 利润大增，波动性推动收入创历史新高
item.description: 洲际交易所周四公布第二季度利润增长，原因是其能源业务的强劲交易量推动了创纪录的收入。【原文：Intercontinental Exchange reported a higher second-quarter profit on Thursday, as strong trading volumes in its energy business drove record revenue.】

item.title: 意大利反对党警告不要让 SpaceX 参与卫星更新
item.description: 议会文件显示，意大利主要反对党民主党（PD）警告乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）领导的执政联盟不要让埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司参与卫星项目的更新，称此举将带来国家安全风险。【原文：Italy's main opposition Democratic Party (PD) has warned Giorgia Meloni's ruling coalition against involving Elon Musk's SpaceX in the update of a satellite programme, parliamentary documents show, saying the move would pose national security risks.】

item.title: 据 NHK 报道，日本赤泽称美国汽车关税削减可能需要时间
item.description: 据日本公共广播公司（NHK）周四报道，日本最高贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世表示，美国可能需要一段时间才能将汽车关税降至15%。【原文：Japan's top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said it might take some time for U.S. tariffs on automobiles to be lowered to 15%, public broadcaster NHK reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 南非准备在最后一刻提出贸易提议以避免美国加征关税
item.description: 南非贸易部长周四表示，在美国官员的敦促下，南非正准备在最后一刻提出一项 "增强型 "贸易提案，希望避免美国在周五开始对南非征收 30% 的关税。【原文：South Africa is preparing a last-minute "enhanced" trade proposal at the urging of U.S. officials in hopes of avoiding a 30% tariff which kicks in on Friday, its trade minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普在维持利率不变后再次抨击美联储主席鲍威尔
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四再次批评美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell），一天前美国央行以9:2的投票结果维持利率稳定。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump again criticised Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Thursday, a day after the U.S. central bank held interest rates steady in a 9-2 vote.】

item.title: 史诗级 "业绩增长推动康卡斯特季度业绩增长
item.description: 受《史诗宇宙》（Epic Universe）五月首映引发的主题公园入园人数激增、国内无线业务增长以及流媒体收入飙升的推动，康卡斯特周四公布的季度收入和利润均超过预期。【原文：Comcast topped estimates for quarterly revenue and profit on Thursday, driven by a surge in theme park attendance sparked by the May debut of "Epic Universe", growth in its domestic wireless business and a spike in streaming revenue.】

item.title: 美国对印度 "令人讨厌 "的非货币贸易壁垒的主要抱怨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三宣布从8月1日起对印度商品征收25%的关税，并对俄罗斯的石油采购实施额外惩罚，他还批评新德里 "强硬而令人讨厌 "的非货币贸易壁垒。特朗普随后表示谈判仍在继续。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday slapped 25% tariffs on Indian goods starting Aug. 1, with an additional penalty on Russian oil purchases, and he criticized New Delhi for its "strenuous and obnoxious" non-monetary trade barriers. Trump said later negotiations were continuing.】

item.title: 关税不确定性和欧佩克+供应增加对油价构成压力：路透调查
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，由于欧佩克+产量增加和美国关税的不确定性对市场构成压力，分析师们对2025年的油价预测基本保持不变。【原文：Analysts are keeping their oil price forecasts mostly unchanged for 2025, as a rise in OPEC+ output and ongoing U.S. tariff uncertainty weigh on the market, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday.】
